notes.discussion: Patient was apparently asymptomatic 10 days back, then she developed fever which is sudden in onset, high grade, intermittent not associated with chills and rigor and relieved on taking medication.

timeline.activity: Patient developed pain abdomen, SOB, loss of appetite
timeline.symptom: Pain abdomen, SOB, loss of appetite

notes.discussion: C/o pain abdomen since 5 days in the epigastric region, associated with abdominal discomfort, bloating sensation and loss of appetite. Shortness of breath since 5 days, which was gradually progressed from (grade 3 - 4)

timeline.activity: Patient was found to have sr creat 5.2 mg/dl and urea 82 mg/dl

notes.investigations: HRCT chest, CT abdomen & pelvis, USG abdomen
notes.discussion: Patient was found to have sr creat 5.2 mg/dl and urea 82 mg/dl. HRCT chest was done revealing bronchitis with mild pleural effusion, CT abdomen & pelvis showed b/l radiodense tiny calculi in both kidneys and hepatomegaly and so the usg abdomen.

timeline.activity: ECG showing normal sinus rhythm with heart rate of 102

notes.discussion: ECG showing normal sinus rhythm with heart rate of 102

notes.discussion: ECG showing ? svt with heart rate 180bpm

timeline.activity: ECG showing normal sinus rhythm with heart rate of 82bpm
